measure.name: process_constructions_windows_skylights
measure.description: This measure assigns a construction to windows/skylights. This measure also creates the interior shading schedule, which is based on shade multipliers and the heating and cooling season logic defined in the Building America House Simulation Protocols. See https://github.com/NREL/resstock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: Calculates material layer properties of constructions for windows/skylights. Finds sub-surfaces and sets applicable constructions. Using interior heating and cooling shading multipliers and the Building America heating and cooling season logic, creates schedule rulesets for window shade and shading control.

argument.name: window_ufactor
argument.description: The heat transfer coefficient of the windows.

argument.name: window_shgc
argument.description: The ratio of solar heat gain through a glazing system compared to that of an unobstructed opening, for windows.

argument.name: window_heat_shade_mult
argument.description: Interior shading multiplier for heating season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc.

argument.name: window_cool_shade_mult
argument.description: Interior shading multiplier for cooling season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc.

argument.name: skylight_ufactor
argument.description: The heat transfer coefficient of the skylights.

argument.name: skylight_shgc
argument.description: The ratio of solar heat gain through a glazing system compared to that of an unobstructed opening, for skylights.

argument.name: skylight_heat_shade_mult
argument.description: Interior shading multiplier for heating season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc.

argument.name: skylight_cool_shade_mult
argument.description: Interior shading multiplier for cooling season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc.
